alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 15 at 4:25PM CST until December 15 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR MONONA AND NORTHERN HARRISON COUNTIES... At 423 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Hornick to near Mondamin, moving northeast at 65 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS! HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing significant wind damage. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Dunlap and nearby communities. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southwestern and west central Iowa...and east central Nebraska. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
